sen.j: 境川 浪右衛門（さかいがわ なみえもん、天保12年4月8日 (旧暦)（1841年5月28日） - 明治20年（1887年）9月16日）は、慶応期から明治期にかけての相撲力士。
sen.e: Namiemon SAKAIGAWA (May 28, 1841 - September 16, 1887) was a sumo wrestler from the Keio era to the Maiji period.
Namiemon SAKAIGAWA (May 28, 1841 - September 16, 1887) was a sumo wrestler from the Keio era to the Maiji period.
Namiemon SAKAIGAWA (May 28, 1841 - September 16, 1887) was a sumo wrestler from the Keio era to the Maiji period.

sen.j: 第14代横綱。
sen.e: He was the 14th Yokozuna (Sumo grand champion).
He was the 14th Yokozuna (Sumo grand champion).
He was the 14th Yokozuna (Sumo grand champion).

sen.j: 身長169cmで記録の残る横綱の中では4番目の小兵力士。
sen.e: He was only 1.69m tall and the fourth shortest wrestler in the recorded Sumo history.
He was only 169 centimeters in height and the fourth shortest Yokozuna in the recorded Sumo history.
sen.cmt: 表記を統一させます。写し間違いがあります。
sen.e: He was only 169 centimeters in height and the fourth shortest Yokozuna in the recorded Sumo history.

sen.j: 体重128kg。
sen.e: He weighed 128Kg.
He weighed 128 kilograms.
He weighed 128 kilograms.

sen.j: 下総国葛飾郡（現・千葉県市川市）出身。
sen.e: He was born in Katsushika District, Shimousa Province (current Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture).
He was from Katsushika County, Shimousa Province (current Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture).
He was from Katsushika County, Shimousa Province (current Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: 本名は宇田川政吉、のちに市川政吉から市川浪右衛門。
sen.e: His real name was Masakichi UDAGAWA; he changed it to Masakichi ICHIKAWA, then to Namiemon ICHIKAWA.
His real name was Masakichi UDAGAWA; he changed it to Masakichi ICHIKAWA, then to Namiemon ICHIKAWA.
His real name was Masakichi UDAGAWA; he changed it to Masakichi ICHIKAWA, then to Namiemon ICHIKAWA.

sen.j: 13歳の頃、酒問屋に奉公に出て四斗樽を軽々と運ぶところを主人に見込まれ、紹介により境川部屋に入門。
sen.e: When he was 13 years old, he was seen to easily carry Shitodaru (72 Liters) of Sake while he was working as an apprenticeship at a liquor wholesaler and the owner introduced him to Sakaigawa Stable.

When he was thirteen years old, he worked at a liquor wholesaler as apprenticeship; the master recognized his talent since he was easily carrying shito-daru (barrel of seventy-two liters), and on the introduction of the master, he entered Sakaigawa Stable.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: When he was thirteen years old, he worked at a liquor wholesaler as apprenticeship; the master recognized his talent since he was easily carrying shito-daru (barrel of seventy-two liters), and on the introduction of the master, he entered Sakaigawa Stable.

sen.j: 安政4年（1857年）11月場所初土俵。
sen.e: His first bout was at the November Tournament of 1857.
His first bout was at the November Tournament of 1857.
His first bout was at the November Tournament of 1857.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）4月場所新入幕。
sen.e: He got into Makuuchi (top) rank at the April Tournament of 1867.
He got into Makuuchi (top) rank at the April Tournament of 1867.
He got into Makuuchi (top) rank at the April Tournament of 1867.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）11月場所後大関に昇進。
sen.e: He was promoted to Ozeki (a sumo wrestler of the second highest rank) at the November Tournament in 1869.
He was promoted to Ozeki (wrestler at the second highest rank) after the November Tournament of 1869.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He was promoted to Ozeki (wrestler at the second highest rank) after the November Tournament of 1869.

sen.j: 四股名をそれまでの増位山（ますいざん）から境川に変え、姫路藩抱えから尾張藩抱えに変わった。
sen.e: He changed his then professional Sumo wrestler name of Masuizan to Saiakgawa and he changed his Domains from Himeji to Owari.
He changed his professional sumo wrestler name from Masuizan to Sakaigawa and changed the clan who retained him from the Himeji clan to the Owari clan.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He changed his professional sumo wrestler name from Masuizan to Sakaigawa and changed the clan who retained him from the Himeji clan to the Owari clan.

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）2月、五条家より横綱が免許され、明治10年（1877年）2月に吉田司家も承認した。
sen.e: In February 1876, the Gojo family gave him a Yokozuna license and in February 1877, the Yoshida-Tsukasa family gave him the license, too.
In February 1876, the Gojo family gave him a Yokozuna license and in February 1877, the Yoshida-Tsukasa family gave him the license, too.
In February 1876, the Gojo family gave him a Yokozuna license and in February 1877, the Yoshida-Tsukasa family gave him the license, too.

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）1月場所限りで引退。
sen.e: He retired after the January Tournament of 1881.
He retired after the January Tournament of 1881.
He retired after the January Tournament of 1881.

sen.j: 年寄境川を襲名した。
sen.e: He inherited the name of Toshiyori (retired wrestler's title) Sakaigawa.
He inherited the name of Sakaigawa as Toshiyori (retired wrestler).
He inherited the name of Sakaigawa as Toshiyori (retired wrestler).

sen.j: しかし余生は短く、46歳の若さで没した。
sen.e: However, his life after that was short and he died at the early age of 45.
However, his life after that was short and he died at the early age of 45.
However, his life after that was short and he died at the early age of 45.

sen.j: 小兵にもかかわらず、太鼓腹で怪力であった。
sen.e: He was small but had a potbelly and was very strong.
He was small but had a potbelly and was very strong.
He was small but had a potbelly and was very strong.

sen.j: 太鼓腹に相手を乗せての櫓投げを得意としていた。
sen.e: He put his opponent on his potbelly and did a Yaguranage (inner thigh throw), which was his specialty.
He put his opponent on his potbelly and did a Yaguranage (inner thigh throw), which was his specialty.
He put his opponent on his potbelly and did a Yaguranage (inner thigh throw), which was his specialty.

sen.j: 相手に十分に相撲を取らせてから勝ちに出るという相撲のため、勝率は高いが引き分けも多く、歴代横綱の中で引分率が最も高い。
sen.e: He let his opponent attack him first then went to win the game and because of this style, his winning rate was high but many draws were recorded; he had the largest percentage of draws among all the Yokozuna in history.

During the match, he always let his opponents fully demonstrate their abilities before he showed his real power to beat them, therefore, although his winning average was high, many draws were recorded as well, and he still hold the record for highest average of draws among all the Yokozuna in history.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: During the match, he always let his opponents fully demonstrate their abilities before he showed his real power to beat them, therefore, although his winning average was high, many draws were recorded as well, and he still hold the record for highest average of draws among all the Yokozuna in history.

sen.j: ただしそのため相手力士からは好感を持たれ、面倒見のよさもあり人望を集めた。
sen.e: However, because of this, his opponents ended up with having good impressions of him and with his service-minded personality, he was very popular.
However, because of such attitudes, he was liked by his opponents, besides since he taught and took care of fellow wrestlers well, he was very popular.
However, because of such attitudes, he was liked by his opponents, besides since he taught and took care of fellow wrestlers well, he was very popular.

sen.j: 本所一ツ目に居所を構えたところから「一ツ目の大名大関」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: He was living in an area called Honjo Hitotsume, therefore, he was called 'Daimyo (Lord) Ozeki of Hitotsume.'
He was living in an area called Honjo Hitotsume, therefore, he was called 'Daimyo (Lord) Ozeki of Hitotsume.'
He was living in an area called Honjo Hitotsume, therefore, he was called 'Daimyo (Lord) Ozeki of Hitotsume.'

sen.j: 明治の谷風梶之助といわれのちに相撲長も務めている。
sen.e: He was called 'Kajinosuke TANIKAZE of Meiji' and later became Sumaino-osa (Sumo director).
He was called 'Kajinosuke TANIKAZE of Meiji' and later became Sumaino-osa (Sumo director).
He was called 'Kajinosuke TANIKAZE of Meiji' and later became Sumaino-osa (Sumo director).

sen.j: 横綱の鬼面山谷五郎との成績は2勝1敗3分だったが、梅ヶ谷藤太郎 (初代)とは5敗1分2預と苦手だった。
sen.e: Against Tanigoro KIMENZAN, he won 2 bouts, lost 1 and had 3 draws; but he did not do well against Totaro UMEGATANI Ⅰwith the result of 5 losses, 1 draw and 2 holds.
Against Yokozuna Tanigoro KIMENZAN, his record was 2 wins, 1 defeat and 3 draws; however he did not do well against Totaro UMEGATANI (the first) with the result of 5 defeats, 1 draw and 2 holds.
Against Yokozuna Tanigoro KIMENZAN, his record was 2 wins, 1 defeat and 3 draws; however he did not do well against Totaro UMEGATANI (the first) with the result of 5 defeats, 1 draw and 2 holds.

sen.j: 家庭的には不幸であった。
sen.e: He did not have a happy marriage.
He did not have a happy marriage.
He did not have a happy marriage.

sen.j: 婿入りして娶った師匠の娘は浪費や不貞を重ねる悪妻で、見るに見かねた弟子が、妻の浮気相手を殴って川に放り込み死亡させるという事件まで発生している。
sen.e: He married into his master's family and his wife wasted their money and repeatedly had affairs; so one of his pupils who could not stand the situation, punched the man who was having an affair with her, threw him into a river and eventually killed him.

He married into his master's family and his wife wasted their money and repeatedly had affairs; so one of his pupils who could not stand the situation, punched the man who was having an affair with her, threw him into a river and eventually killed him.

He married into his master's family and his wife wasted their money and repeatedly had affairs; so one of his pupils who could not stand the situation, punched the man who was having an affair with her, threw him into a river and eventually killed him.

sen.j: 晩年は茶の湯や俳諧に親しんだが、早世したのは相撲会所での意見の相違や家庭問題での心労が祟ったから、といわれている。
sen.e: After retiring, he was enjoying Chanoyu (tea ceremonies) and Haikai (writing seventeen-syllable verses) but he was said to die early because of the mental stress from the difference of opinions in Sumo Kaisho (meeting place) and his marriage problems.

After retiring, he was enjoying Chanoyu (tea ceremonies) and Haikai (writing seventeen-syllable verses), however he died at an early age which has been said that because he had been wasted by the mental stress from the difference of opinions in Sumo Kaisho (meeting place) and his family problems.

After retiring, he was enjoying Chanoyu (tea ceremonies) and Haikai (writing seventeen-syllable verses), however he died at an early age which has been said that because he had been wasted by the mental stress from the difference of opinions in Sumo Kaisho (meeting place) and his family problems.

tit.cmt: 前段の幕内の説明を活かします。

sen.e: 28 Tournaments, 118 wins, 23 losses, 72 draws, 5 holds and 63 absences; winning rate 83.7%
28 tournaments, 118 wins, 23 defeats, 71 draws, 5 holds and 63 absences; winning average 83.7%
sen.cmt: 数字写し間違いがあります。
sen.e: 28 tournaments, 118 wins, 23 defeats, 71 draws, 5 holds and 63 absences; winning average 83.7%

sen.j: 優勝相当成績5回。
sen.e: He got 5 titles which are equivalent to the Championship level today.
He got 5 titles which are equivalent to the Championship level today.
He got 5 titles which are equivalent to the Championship level today.
